statement:
Given four complex numbers $x_1,x_2,y_1,y_2$, either $x_1/x_2$ or
$y_1/y_2$ is rational, or one of the four numbers $\exp(x_i y_j)$ is
transcendental.

This conjecture is stronger than the six exponentials theorem.

[9]{} Waldschmidt, Michel, [*Diophantine approximation on linear
algebraic groups. Transcendence properties of the exponential function
in several variables*]{}. Grundlehren der Mathematischen Wissenschaften
\[Fundamental Principles of Mathematical Sciences\], 326.
Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 2000. xxiv+633 pp. ISBN 3-540-66785-7.
